title: Liam incurs a loss of 5% by selling a watch for 1140. At what price should the watch be sold to earn 5% profit? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price be x. Since, Cost Price - Loss = Selling Price x - (5% of x) = $1140 x - (5/100×x) = $1140 x - (1/20x) = $1140 20x/20 - 1x/20 = $1140 19x/20 = $1140 x = (1140×20)/19 = 22,800/19 = $1200 If he wants to get 5% profit, the selling price should be x + (5% of x) Since x = $1200 Selling price = $1200 + (5% of $1200) 105% of 1200 = selling price 105/100×1200 = selling price = $1260. The price at which the watch should be sold to get a profit margin of 5%, is therefore $1260

Ans S.P of watch = 1140 Let C.P of watch = 100 Loss = 5% Therefore S.P = 100 - 5 = 95 Applying unitary method When S.P is 95 C.P = 100 When S.P is 1 C.P = 100/95 When S.P is 1140 then C.P = (100/95) × 1140 = 1200 Required profit 5% i.e 5% of 1200 (5/100) × 1200 = 60/- Therefore S.P of watch in order to make a profit of 5% is = 1200 + 60 = 1260/- Ans
